data.text: Contents
Introduction

Regular manual repositioning as part of effective pressure area care can be intrusive and distressing for patients who may have end stage disease progression, or a history of dementia and/or delirium. It can also be distressing for family, and clinicians who provide this care.

Alternative repositioning strategies should be considered for these patients to prevent pressure damage from occurring, or to minimise deterioration to any pre- existing pressure damage. Patient dignity should be maintained and comfort ensured, and wishes met as far as possible.
The Toto lateral turning system provides an alternative repositioning option for these patients.
Scope
The purpose of this document is to:
To set minimum safety standards for Registered Nurses and Midwives, and Medical personnel who may be required to care for a patient who requires the use of the Toto lateral turning system
To describe minimum standard for patient records.
To ensure local governance requirements are met
Definitions

table_items.text: Consistent and controlled automated lateral patient turning system Comprising a lifting and turning platform with a control unit, the Toto system gently moves patients at regular intervals (determined by the health care professional) to assist with repositioning and pressure damage prevention whilst reducing the dependency of staff. The Toto system fits any hospital bed and can be used in conjunction with standard or dynamic mattresses.

Standard of practice
This SOP only covers repositioning regimes for patients who require the use of the Toto lateral turning system management to support their position change.
Regular manual repositioning regimes will be covered by the policy for Prevention and Management of Pressure Ulcers.

Information relating to the patient and their presenting problem is collated in accordance with standards set by the practitioner's professional organisation.

Patients will be individually assessed by an appropriately registered practitioner to ensure it is appropriate to use the Toto lateral turning system.
Process
The aim of using the Toto turning system is to provide effective repositioning for patients who cannot tolerate manual repositioning due to their medical condition.
Pre-assessment
Indications and contraindications must be followed to identify if the Toto lateral turning system is appropriate for a patient when manual repositioning is not preferred or appropriate.

table_items.text: Indications for using the Toto lateral turning system

The Toto lateral turning system is suitable for patients assessed to be at risk to very high risk of pressure damage: With a maximum weight of 250kg Who are unable to change their position without assistance Identified as requiring regular repositioning Who are on the End of Life Pathway Who are unable to tolerate manual repositioning and/or find the intervention distressing
Contraindications for using the Toto lateral turning system
The Toto lateral turning system is not suitable for patients: with unstable spinal cord injuries undergoing traction with equilibrium disturbances

data.text: Using the Toto lateral turning system
Before using the Toto lateral turning system, a holistic patient assessment must be undertaken to identify if the system is appropriate to meet their repositioning care needs.

Where the Toto lateral turning system is appropriate for a patient, it must be provided at the earliest opportunity. This is subject to their consent or if they lack capacity, in their best interest. This must be documented in the patient's clinical record.

A structured and well documented repositioning care plan must be in place, setting out clear and concise instructions on the required regime. This will ensure patients receive appropriate repositioning in line with their clinical need, and reduce the likelihood of new pressure related skin damage being sustained. This will in turn help ensure patient dignity, and maintain comfort, with minimal pain, on repositioning.
If the Toto lateral turning system is purchased by Wards they are responsible for the safe handling, storage, arranging training and appropriate use thereof.
Staff should inform Tissue Viability Team when the Toto system is in use.

table_items.text: The Toto is placed on the bed platform underneath the mattress The patient should be positioned along the central line of the mattress by aligning the patients nose with the centre point of the headboard Staff will determine the appropriate turning cycle with independent left and right inflation periods. Five pre-set time intervals for inflation and rest periods from 30 minutes to four hours, allows for customised care. The system also includes a default mode comprising left and right inflation plus rest period all set at two hours. The rest period should be used during nursing interventions, hygiene, mealtimes etc. If patients cannot control their limbs and beds sides are being used, padding is recommended Twice daily skin assessments should be maintained and documented on the daily charts

data.text: Cleaning and decontamination of the Toto lateral turning system

table_items.text: In the absence of gross contamination or unusual risk, the removal of dirt and spillages with a neutral detergent and warm water should be sufficient. Trust approved disinfectant e.g. chlorine solution may also be used. Clinell Universal wipes are suitable. Ensure that the cover is rinsed with clean water using a single use, nonabrasive cloth and thoroughly dried. Ensure adequate ventilation.

In cases of gross contamination the Toto lateral turning system platform cover should be cleaned first with detergent and water and then with a Trust approved disinfectant e.g. chlorine solution. Clinell Universal wipes are also suitable. Rinse well with clean water and wipe down with a single use, nonabrasive cloth and thoroughly dry. Ensure adequate ventilation.

data.text: Training requirements
Clinicians installing and using the Toto lateral turning system must have training on the safe and effective use of the system before using it as part of a patient's repositioning regime.
Training will be provided by Frontier Medical staff, and support provided to Ward areas when the Toto is in use. The local representative can be contacted via info@frontier-group.co.uk
The Ward should keep a training record of staff who attended training on the system.
Additional training information can be found via Youtube: Toto Quick Reference Guide Video - UK - YouTube
